0.user_question: Steve loves playing video games.  His parents get him a console along with 9481974 games for his birthday.  He saves up enough money to buy 1 game per month for a year, and then the following year he starts buying 2 games a month.  For the third year he buys 4 games a month as he has a new part-time job that makes him more money.  He also gets 9481974 games for Christmas every year.  How many games does Steve have after 3 years?

direct_answer.text:
Let's think step by step. Initially, Steve has 9481974 games. Each year, he saves up enough money to buy 1 game per month, so he can buy 12 games in a year. So, in the first year, he bought 12 games. In the second year, he bought twice as many games as the previous year (i.e., 24 games). And in the third year, he bought four times as many games as he did in the first year (i.e., 48 games). This adds up to a total of 12 + 24 + 48 = 84 games he bought during those three years. Also, he gets 9481974 games every Christmas, so he gains 9481974 games each year. Adding them all up, we get the number of games he has at the end of the third year:

Initially:   9481974 games
Year 1:     12 games
Year 2:     24 games
Year 3:     48 games
Christmas: 9481974
